title: Concert: Latino Music Festival—Luis Rafael Vivanco
hero_caption: Luis Rafael Vivanco. Photo courtesy of the artist.
short_description: Presented with the Latino Music Festival
list_description: Presented with the Latino Music Festival
description:
Luis Rafael Vivanco performs a guitar journey through the history of Peru. Hear the Peruvian roots in the work “Echoes of the Incas”; the baroque colonial music of the Viceroyalty of Peru; classical music from the independence era; and Romantic works by Pedro Abrill Ximénez y Tirado, who was known as the “Rossini of the Americas.”

About the artist

Luis Rafael Vivanco began his early studies in classical guitar in Peru. He went on to complete his music degree at the University of British Columbia, where he studied with Michael Strutt. While completing this degree, he learned the lute and baroque guitar from Ray Nurse. He received his masters in music in guitar performance with Denis Azabagic at Roosevelt University in Chicago. Luis has performed in Canada, Mexico, Peru, and the United States. He has played in master classes for many guitarists such as Alexander Dunn, Eduardo Fernandez, Fabio Zanon, Jason Vieux, Laura Oltman, Pablo Cohen, and Pamela Kimmel, among others. He divides his time between ensemble and solo performing and teaching.
